DOC.brief_summary: This study assess impact nutritional intervention aim reduce childhood overweight German preschooler .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Pre-school-based Nutritional Intervention Children 's Eating Behavior Anthropometric Parameters
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To assess impact nutritional intervention aim reduce childhood overweight German preschooler . Design : Using cluster-randomized study design waiting-list control , test six-month intervention administer weekly nutritional expert consist joint meal preparation activity child parent like taste prepare nutritious , fresh food . At baseline , six twelve month , parent-completed questionnaire assess fruit vegetable intake ( primary outcome ) water sugar drink consumption ( outcomes ) . Direct measurement assess BMI , percentage body fat ( skin fold thickness ) waist-to-height-ratio . An intention-to-treat analysis use random effect panel regression model ass intervention effect , adjust child 's age , gender , immigrant background maternal education . Setting : 18 Preschools three south German region . Subjects : Healthy child three seven year age .
DOC.criteria: Preschools eligible participate study locate one three predefined region apply participate nutritional intervention module statesponsored health promotion programme 'Komm mit da gesunde Boot ' ( 'Come aboard health boat ' ) , least fifteen child participate . Healthy child eligible preschool Age 3 year 7 year Serious health problem Genetic condition Metabolic diseases Acute infectious disease
